      • adjustPreviewParameters

        public Camera.Parameters adjustPreviewParameters(Camera.Parameters parameters)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        Implement this to configure the Camera.Parameters for the purposes of the preview. Note that you will have another chance to configure the Camera.Parameters for a specific photo via adjustPictureParameters().
        Specified by:
        adjustPreviewParameters in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        parameters - the Camera.Parameters to be modified
        Returns:
        the Camera.Parameters that was passed in

      • configureRecorderAudio

        public void configureRecorderAudio(int cameraId,
                          MediaRecorder recorder)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        This will be called by the library to give you a chance to configure the audio of the MediaRecorder, just prior to beginning to record a video. Please ONLY configure audio here.
        Specified by:
        configureRecorderAudio in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        cameraId - the camera that will be used for recording
        recorder - the MediaRecorder to be configured

      • configureRecorderOutput

        public void configureRecorderOutput(int cameraId,
                           MediaRecorder recorder)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        This will be called by the library to give you a chance to configure the output of the MediaRecorder, just prior to beginning to record a video. Please ONLY configure output here.
        Specified by:
        configureRecorderOutput in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        cameraId - the camera that will be used for recording
        recorder - the MediaRecorder to be configured

      • configureRecorderProfile

        public void configureRecorderProfile(int cameraId,
                            MediaRecorder recorder)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        This will be called by the library to give you a chance to configure the profile of the MediaRecorder, just prior to beginning to record a video. Please ONLY configure profile here.
        Specified by:
        configureRecorderProfile in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        cameraId - the camera that will be used for recording
        recorder - the MediaRecorder to be configured

      • getCameraId

        public int getCameraId()
        Specified by:
        getCameraId in interface CameraHost
        Returns:
        the ID of the camera that you want to use for previews and picture/video taking with the associated CameraView instance

        Specified by:
        getDeviceProfile in interface CameraHost
        Returns:
        the DeviceProfile to use for custom-tailoring the behavior of CameraView, to overcome device-specific idiosyncrasies

      • getPictureSize

        public Camera.Size getPictureSize(Camera.Parameters parameters)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        Called to allow you to be able to indicate what size photo should be taken.
        Specified by:
        getPictureSize in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        parameters - the current camera parameters
        Returns:
        the size of photo to take (note: must be a supported size!)

      • getPreviewSize

        public Camera.Size getPreviewSize(int displayOrientation,
                         int width,
                         int height,
                         Camera.Parameters parameters)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        Called to allow you to indicate what size preview should be used
        Specified by:
        getPreviewSize in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        displayOrientation - orientation of the display in degrees
        width - width of the available preview space
        height - height of the available preview space
        parameters - the current camera parameters
        Returns:
        the size of the preview to use (note: must be a supported preview size!)

      • getPreferredPreviewSizeForVideo

        public Camera.Size getPreferredPreviewSizeForVideo(int displayOrientation,
                                          int width,
                                          int height,
                                          Camera.Parameters parameters,
                                          Camera.Size deviceHint)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        Same as getPreviewSize(), but called when we anticipate taking videos, as some devices may work better with lower-resolution previews, to reduce CPU load
        Specified by:
        getPreferredPreviewSizeForVideo in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:
        displayOrientation - orientation of the display in degrees
        width - width of the available preview space
        height - height of the available preview space
        parameters - the current camera parameters
        deviceHint - the size that the device itself thinks should be used for video, which sometimes is ridiculously low
        Returns:
        the size of the preview to use (note: must be a supported preview size!)

      • getShutterCallback

        public Camera.ShutterCallback getShutterCallback()
        Specified by:
        getShutterCallback in interface CameraHost
        Returns:
        the Camera.ShutterCallback to be used with the camera, for sound effects and such

      • handleException

        public void handleException(java.lang.Exception e)
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        Called when something blows up in CameraView, to allow you to alert the user as you see fit
        Specified by:
        handleException in interface CameraHost
        Parameters:

      • mirrorFFC

        public boolean mirrorFFC()
        Specified by:
        mirrorFFC in interface CameraHost
        Returns:
        true if you want the saved output to be mirrored when using the front-facing camera, false to leave it alone

      • saveImage

        Description copied from interface: CameraHost

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • useSingleShotMode

        public boolean useSingleShotMode()
        Specified by:
        useSingleShotMode in interface CameraHost
        Returns:
        true if you want the camera to keep the preview disabled after taking a picture (e.g., you want to present the picture to the user for editing or processing), false if you want preview to be re-enabled (e.g., you want the user to be able to take another picture right away)

      • autoFocusAvailable

        public void autoFocusAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: CameraHost
        This will be called by the library to let you know that auto-focus is available for your use, so you can update your UI accordingly.
        Specified by:
        autoFocusAvailable in interface CameraHost

      • rotateBasedOnExif

        public boolean rotateBasedOnExif()
        Specified by:
        rotateBasedOnExif in interface CameraHost
        Returns:
        true if you want the library to rotate the image file to match what is in the EXIF headers, which can be useful for devices that, in portrait mode, take landscape pictures and simply mark them via EXIF headers that picture viewers should rotate the image
